ARABIC: وَكَانُوا۟ يَقُولُونَ أَئِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and saying, 'When we are dead and turned to dust and bones, shall we then be raised again
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And said: "What! When we are dead and turned to dust and bones, shall we then be raised again?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: They used to say: “What! Once we are dead and are reduced to dust and bones, shall we still be raised to a new life from the dead?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: It was they who said, "Shall we be resurrected after we die and have turned into dust and bones?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And they used to say, “When we are dead and have turned into dust and bones, will we surely be raised again?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And they used to say: "When we die and become dust and bones, shall we then indeed be resurrected"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And they used to say: What! when we die and have become dust and bones, shall we then indeed be raised?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: ever saying, 'What, when we are dead and become dust and bones, shall we indeed be raised up?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And they used to say: When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we then, forsooth, be raised again,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and they used to say, "What! After we have died and become dust and bones, shall we indeed be raised up again?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And they were wont to say: when we have died and become dust and bones, shall we, then, verily be raised?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And they used to say, ‘What! When we are dead and become dust and bones, shall we be resurrected?!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And they used to say, "What! when we die and become dust and bones, shall we then indeed be raised up again?-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And they used to say: "When we die and become dust and bones, shall we then indeed be resurrected?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and constantly said: 'What, when we are dead and become dust and bones, shall we then be restored to life?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And they used to say, “When we are dead and turned into dust and bones, are we to be resurrected?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And they used to say, "When we die and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [56:47] And they used to say, ‘What! When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we indeed be resurrected? (in both instances [a-idhā and a-innā] the two hamzas may be read either by pronouncing them fully, or by not pronouncing the second, and in either case inserting an intervening alif).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And they used to say) in the life of the world: (When we are dead and have come) scattered (dust and) rotten (bones, shall we then, forsooth, be raised again) shall we then be given life again,
